page.title: 13ECOLOGY
page.content: Life is no longer governed by the rhythm of the seasons.Harvest is no longer the climax of the village year since the anonymous combines and 'jumbo balers'sweep the vast fields and mark up increased profits for the multi-nationals. Dutch Elm disease in the late '70's decimated the area of its finest trees and destroyed the habitat of much wildlife.Even the surviving wildlife is ravaged by the big-time poachers who use the M5 for access and egress.Increased leisure time has awakened the interest of the villages in their assets and the footpaths are determindly tramped by enthusiasts, thus ensuring their survival.
